abstract: RockMelt, a company founded and financed by a group of Netscape alumni, will release a new Web browser, 16 years after Netscape introduced the first commercial Internet browsers. This one, they say, is a browser for the Facebook era.
snippet: RockMelt, a company founded and financed by a group of Netscape alumni, will release a new Web browser, 16 years after Netscape introduced the first commercial Internet browsers. This one, they say, is a browser for the Facebook era.
lead_paragraph: Silicon Valley is awash in tales of the “PayPal Mafia,” the tight-knit group of PayPal alumni who have helped one another start and finance a crop of new companies.

headline.main: RockMelt Releases Browser for Facebook Era

abstract: In a rare interview, Bill Campbell talks about his role as an adviser to RockMelt and how the rivalry between Google and Apple forced him to stop advising Google.
snippet: In a rare interview, Bill Campbell talks about his role as an adviser to RockMelt and how the rivalry between Google and Apple forced him to stop advising Google.
lead_paragraph: In Silicon Valley, where even mid-level executives seem to be escorted by public relations handlers, Bill Campbell is a bit of an exception. An elder statesman of the tech industry, he prefers to remain out of the limelight.

headline.main: Bill Campbell on Coaching RockMelt and Google vs. Apple
